Header: Djokovic sends warning to rivals with Paris Masters title
Content: World number one Novak Djokovic saw off Canadian Denis Shapovalov 6-3 6-4 to win his fifth Paris Masters title in a warning to his rivals ahead of the ATP Finals. The Serbian faced only one break point in another impressive display to claim a 34th career Masters title against world number 28 Shapovalov, who was playing his first final at that level. Djokovic did not drop a set all week but will be supplanted by Rafael Nadal at top of the ATP rankings, made a fine start, stealing Shapovalovâ€™s first service game as he opened a 3-0 lead.
